misuses.misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
misuses.description: The use of MD5 hash function is known to be insecure and should not be used for cryptographic purposes. It is vulnerable to hash collisions and can be easily broken.
misuses.recommendation: Use a secure hash function such as SHA-256, SHA-384 or SHA-512 instead of MD5.
